title: Cyanotic heart defect
text:
A cyanotic heart defect is any <a href="congenital%20heart%20defect">congenital heart defect</a> (CHD) that occurs due to deoxygenated <a href="blood">blood</a> bypassing the <a href="lung">lung</a>s and entering the <a href="systemic%20circulation">systemic circulation</a>, or a mixture of oxygenated and unoxygenated blood entering the systemic circulation. It is caused by structural defects of the heart such as <a href="right-to-left%20shunt">right-to-left</a> or <a href="bidirectional%20shunt">bidirectional</a> <a href="shunt%20%28medical%29">shunting</a>, malposition of the <a href="great%20arteries">great arteries</a>, or any condition which increases <a href="pulmonary%20vascular%20resistance">pulmonary vascular resistance</a>. The result may be the development of collateral circulation.
Signs and symptoms.
Presentation includes the following:
